lesson_01.Title: Calling a waiter
lesson_01.Info: When you want to call a waiter to order drinks...
lesson_01.Memo: Waiter is called "konobar" in Croatian, or "konobarica" if it's female waiter, but it's not polite to call "Konobar!" in the bar.

lesson_02.Title: Waiter's reply
lesson_02.Info: A waiter would usually ask you...
lesson_02.Translation: Please, what do you want to drink?
lesson_02.Memo: More often a waiter would just ask "Izvolite?", meaning "Yes, please?"

lesson_03.Title: Beer
lesson_03.Memo:
If you're ordering more than one beer, then the word "pivo" changes to "piva":
"Dva piva" = "Two beers",
"Tri piva" = "Three beers", etc...

lesson_04.Title: Coffee
lesson_04.Phrase: Jednu kavu s mlijekom, molim vas.
lesson_04.Info: To order a coffee with milk...
lesson_04.Memo: If you order just a coffe in Croatian bars it usually means an espresso.

lesson_05.Title: Water
lesson_05.Info: To ask for a glass of water...
lesson_05.Translation: Can I have a glass of water?

lesson_06.Title: Wine 1
lesson_06.Info: To ask for the wine offer...
lesson_06.Translation: What kind of wines do you have?
lesson_06.Memo: Croatia offers a variety of quality wines. Some of the best known are Babić, Malvazija, Pošip, Plavac, Dingač and others...

lesson_07.Title: Wine 2
lesson_07.Memo:
We actually say "black wine" for "red wine" in Croatia.
"Crno" = "Black"
"Crveno" = "Red"
"Bijelo" = "White"
"Crno vino" = "Red wine"

lesson_08.Title: Brandy
lesson_08.Memo: Rakija is our domestic brandy, usualy made out of grapes or plums. The third most common kind of rakija is "travarica", a grape brandy infused with mediterranean herbs.

lesson_09.Title: Cocktails
lesson_09.Info: To ask if the bar offers cocktails...
lesson_09.Memo: We have domesticated the word "cocktail" to "koktel".

lesson_10.Title: Payment
lesson_10.Memo:
A waiter could ask you "Mogu li naplatiti?", meaning "Can i charge you?"
"Platiti" = "To pay"
"Naplatiti" = To charge"

lesson_11.Title: Bill
lesson_11.Memo:
"Račun" means "a bill, a check", but it can also mean "a calculation".
"Računati" = "To calculate, to count"
"Račun" = "A bill, a calculation"

lesson_12.Title: Credit cards
lesson_12.Info: To ask if you can pay with a credit card...
lesson_12.Memo: A waiter could ask you "Gotovina ili kartica", meaning "Cash or card?"
